8f88da38-ac40-4c93-b7b0-696ec02cea7a.name: Phishing Delivery via LNK File Executing MSHTA to Deploy HTA-Embedded DLL Payload
8f88da38-ac40-4c93-b7b0-696ec02cea7a.description:
This threat vector represents a sophisticated multi-stage infection chain employed by Pakistan-aligned 
APT groups to compromise Indian defense and government entities. The attack begins with a spearphishing 
email containing a malicious LNK file disguised as a legitimate document. When executed by the victim, 
the LNK file leverages mshta.exe to retrieve and execute an HTA file from attacker-controlled infrastructure.

The HTA file contains JavaScript code that decrypts and loads an embedded DLL payload, which subsequently 
writes a decoy PDF to disk, establishes C2 communication, and displays the decoy to the user. Before 
deploying the final payload (Geta RAT), the malware performs security software discovery to adapt its 
persistence mechanism, demonstrating defense-aware behaviour.

The technique's effectiveness stems from combining social engineering, abuse of trusted system binaries 
(Living Off The Land), multi-stage execution, and dynamic evasion techniques. The use of compromised 
legitimate domains for payload hosting further reduces detection probability and increases victim trust.

1.0.message: feat: Add detection rules for Chrome spawning unexpected child processes and LNK file execution invoking MSHTA.
1.0.author: Nicola

cb0a2cd0-510b-412b-9d79-2fe5394b15b3.name: Browser Exploitation via Chrome CVE-2026-2441 Use-After-Free in CSS
cb0a2cd0-510b-412b-9d79-2fe5394b15b3.description:
CVE-2026-2441 represents a critical use-after-free vulnerability in Chrome's CSS rendering engine that 
was actively exploited as a zero-day before patch availability. The vulnerability enables remote code 
execution within the browser sandbox through crafted HTML pages, requiring only user navigation to a 
malicious URL with no additional user interaction needed.

Google acknowledged active exploitation but witeld details on threat actors and targets, suggesting 
sophisticated threat activity potentially targeting high-value individuals or organisations. The rapid 
two-day window between discovery and patch release indicates the severity and active exploitation status.

This threat vector exemplifies modern browser exploitation techniques where initial access is achieved 
through memory corruption vulnerabilities, providing a foothold for further exploitation including 
sandbox escape, credential harvesting, and persistent implant deployment.

1.0.message: feat: Add detection rules for Chrome spawning unexpected child processes and LNK file execution invoking MSHTA.
1.0.author: Nicola

323d773d-d1ba-4fb8-b43a-0dfe70d492d7.name: Commercial Mobile Spyware Enabling Real-Time Surveillance and Financial Theft via Fake App Distribution
323d773d-d1ba-4fb8-b43a-0dfe70d492d7.description:
ZeroDayRAT is a commercial cross-platform mobile spyware platform advertised on Telegram that enables 
comprehensive device surveillance and financial theft on Android and iOS devices. The platform provides 
buyers with a malware builder and self-hosted management panel, offering capabilities including real-time 
GPS tracking, keystroke logging, SMS interception (including OTPs), account enumeration, live camera and 
microphone streaming, cryptocurrency wallet manipulation, and banking credential theft. Distributed via 
social engineering and fake app marketplaces, the spyware exemplifies the commoditisation of sophisticated 
mobile surveillance capabilities previously limited to nation-state actors, making comprehensive mobile 
compromise accessible to a broader range of threat actors through a commercial offering.

1.0.message: feat: Add detection rules for Chrome spawning unexpected child processes and LNK file execution invoking MSHTA.
1.0.author: Nicola

bff2f55e-8100-4d10-9172-9a3b1171268f.name: Phishing Delivery via LNK File Executing MSHTA to Deploy HTA-Embedded DLL Payload
bff2f55e-8100-4d10-9172-9a3b1171268f.description:
This detection objective aims to identify and alert on multi-stage infection chains that leverage 
malicious LNK files to execute mshta.exe for deploying HTA-embedded payloads. This attack pattern 
is commonly employed by APT36 (Transparent Tribe) and SideCopy groups targeting Indian defense 
and government entities.

The objective focuses on detecting the complete attack chain from initial phishing delivery through 
to payload execution and persistence establishment, with particular emphasis on Living Off The Land 
Binary (LOLBin) abuse and defense-aware behaviour patterns.

1.0.message: feat: Add detection rules for Chrome spawning unexpected child processes and LNK file execution invoking MSHTA.
1.0.author: Nicola

5ef0bc94-2e80-4f13-94cc-18976ddb7622.name: Browser Exploitation via Chrome CVE-2026-2441 Use-After-Free in CSS
5ef0bc94-2e80-4f13-94cc-18976ddb7622.description:
Detect exploitation of CVE-2026-2441, a use-after-free vulnerability in Chrome's CSS engine
that enables remote code execution via crafted HTML pages. This actively exploited zero-day
allows threat actors to achieve arbitrary code execution within the browser sandbox, potentially
leading to data theft, credential harvesting, or as a stepping stone for full system compromise.

The detection objective focuses on identifying malicious browser activity patterns, suspicious
process behaviors, and network indicators associated with exploitation attempts targeting
unpatched Chrome installations (versions prior to 145.0.7632.75).

1.0.message: feat: Add detection rules for Chrome spawning unexpected child processes and LNK file execution invoking MSHTA.
1.0.author: Nicola

d076a0a4-e467-4346-99a3-5dd011a2df04.name: Chrome Spawning Unexpected Child Processes
d076a0a4-e467-4346-99a3-5dd011a2df04.description:
Detects Google Chrome browser spawning suspicious child processes that are uncommon for normal
web browsing operations. This detection targets post-exploitation activity associated with
CVE-2026-2441, a use-after-free vulnerability in Chrome's CSS engine enabling sandboxed remote
code execution.

Chrome's multi-process architecture normally spawns only specific child processes (chrome.exe
instances for renderers/GPU, crashpad_handler.exe for crash reporting, software_reporter_tool.exe
for cleanup). Execution of scripting utilities (cmd.exe, powershell.exe, wscript.exe, cscript.exe)
or other system binaries indicates potential exploitation and sandbox escape attempts.

This rule filters out legitimate Chrome child processes while alerting on high-risk execution
patterns that suggest compromise.

1.0.message: feat: Add detection rules for Chrome spawning unexpected child processes and LNK file execution invoking MSHTA.
1.0.author: Nicola

edbc828b-6b51-4aa5-8d7f-c33c41b65282.name: LNK File Execution Invoking MSHTA
edbc828b-6b51-4aa5-8d7f-c33c41b65282.description:
Detects execution of mshta.exe spawned by Windows Explorer or other shell processes where the 
parent process chain indicates LNK file interaction. This detection identifies the initial execution 
vector where malicious shortcut files invoke mshta.exe to retrieve and execute remote HTA payloads.

The detection focuses on identifying mshta.exe process creation events with command-line arguments 
pointing to remote URLs (http/https), particularly when the parent process is explorer.exe. This 
pattern is highly indicative of malicious LNK files being used as an initial access vector.

Key indicators monitored:
- mshta.exe process creation
- Parent process is explorer.exe (shell context)
- Command line contains HTTP/HTTPS URLs
- Process spawned in user context (not system services)

This detection is part of a multi-stage detection objective covering the complete attack chain 
from phishing delivery through post-exploitation activities.

1.0.message: feat: Add detection rules for Chrome spawning unexpected child processes and LNK file execution invoking MSHTA.
